resources.string: Your geomagnetic location is the distance from your closest geomagnetic pole. The best place to see the aurora is at around 23Â°. Earth\'s geomagnetic poles are located close to the north and south pole.
Geomagnetic activity is the cause the aurora and ranges from 0 to 9. The higher this value is, the higher the chance of seeing the aurora.
Clouds can block your view of the aurora. This shows the amount of clouds at your location as a percentage. A value of 0% is optimal.
Because the aurora is only visible in the dark, the position of the sun is important. This shows how dark your location is based on the sun's position.
